course_title: Topics in Nutrition Health Sciences: Nutritional Metabolomics
course_description: This interdisciplinary course will introduce students to the biological concepts underlying nutritional metabolomics, methodologies and approaches to data preparation and analysis, including the strengths and limitations of various approaches. Upon completion of the course, students will have a foundational understanding of metabolomics, its applications in nutrition and health sciences, methods of analyses and how to access online tools for analyses of metabolomics data.
schedule_location: M 10am-12pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R345
sections: Class Nbr: 2177, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 10a-12p, Instructor: Team, Status: Open
